Package com.tc_4.carbon_counter.controllers

Class StatsController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tc_4.carbon_counter.controllers.StatsController
  • @RestController
public class StatsController
extends java.lang.Object
    The statistics controller provides an API to handle commands related to adding, removing, and viewing a user's statistics. This controller deals with all mappings beginning with /stats/
    Author:
    Colton Glick, Andrew Pester
    See Also:
    StatsService

      StatsController()

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      DailyStats addDailyStats​(DailyStats dailyStats)
      Add a daily statistic for the specified user in the json body.
      java.util.List<DailyStats> getLastMonthUserDailyStats​(java.lang.String username)
      Returns an array of daily stats for dates that are grater than the current date - 1 month.
      java.util.List<DailyStats> getUserDailyStats​(java.lang.String username)
      Returns an array containing the daily stats for the specified user or an empty array if no stats are found for the user
      java.util.Optional<DailyStats> getUserDailyStatsByDate​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String date)
      Returns the daily stats for the specified user on the specified day
      java.util.Optional<DailyStats> getUserDailyStatsToday​(java.lang.String username)
      Returns the daily stats that have been entered for today, or null if no stats have been entered yet.

    • Method Detail

      • getUserDailyStats

        @GetMapping("/stats/{username}")
public java.util.List<DailyStats> getUserDailyStats​(@PathVariable
                                                    java.lang.String username)
        Returns an array containing the daily stats for the specified user or an empty array if no stats are found for the user
        Parameters:
        username - pass as a path variable
        Returns:
        A JSON Array

      • getUserDailyStatsByDate

        @GetMapping("/stats/{date}/{username}")
public java.util.Optional<DailyStats> getUserDailyStatsByDate​(@PathVariable
                                                              java.lang.String username,
                                                              @PathVariable
                                                              java.lang.String date)
        Returns the daily stats for the specified user on the specified day
        Parameters:
        username - Pass as a path variable
        date - Enter date as a path variable in the format "yyyy-MM-dd"
        Returns:
        The most recent Daily stats entry for that day or null if none exists

      • getUserDailyStatsToday

        @GetMapping("/stats/today/{username}")
public java.util.Optional<DailyStats> getUserDailyStatsToday​(@PathVariable
                                                             java.lang.String username)
        Returns the daily stats that have been entered for today, or null if no stats have been entered yet.
        Parameters:
        username - Provide as a path variable
        Returns:
        a JSON object if a stats entry exists, if not returns null

      • getLastMonthUserDailyStats

        @GetMapping("/stats/lastMonth/{username}")
public java.util.List<DailyStats> getLastMonthUserDailyStats​(@PathVariable
                                                             java.lang.String username)
        Returns an array of daily stats for dates that are grater than the current date - 1 month. EX: If today is 2020-10-31, would return everything on 2020-09-30 and after
        Parameters:
        username - pass as a path variable
        Returns:
        A JSON array of the daily stats from the last month

      • addDailyStats

        @PostMapping("/stats/addDaily")
public DailyStats addDailyStats​(@RequestBody
                                DailyStats dailyStats)
        Add a daily statistic for the specified user in the json body. Required fields: username. If an entry already exists for this user today, it will be overwritten by this new entry.
        Parameters:
        dailyStats - Pass the statistics via the JSON body, the only required field is the username to assign the stats to.
        Returns:
        The daily stats object if it was successfully saved to the database.
